1.question: Which one of the following suture materials is commonly used for skin closure in adult patients undergoing abdominal surgery?
1.explanation: absorbable: catgut, vicryl, monocryl, PDS (delayed); non-absorbable: nylon, prolene, steel wires

3.d: Sentinel LN biopsy can be done
3.e: Tamoxifen is safe for bridging therapy for surgery
3.explanation: Chemotherapy is not absolutely contraindicated, can be started in 2nd or 3rd trimester if absolutely necessary

4.a: retro-areolar mass, what is the cause?
4.explanation: Gynecomastia definitely more common than male breast cancer

14.explanation: Mediastinoscopy used for middle and posterior mediastinum.

15.explanation: Drainage should be surgical, not through colonoscopy

20.d: Right sided CA colon has worse prognosis than left sided CA
20.e: Pre-op CEA level signifies the prognosis

23.explanation: Ileal pouch anatomosis involves separating ileus from small bowel, then using this ileus to act as a rectum.

32.question: A 25 years old man with locally advanced CA tongue underwent resection and
32.a: moradiotherapy. Which is not an indication for the latter?
32.b: Extracapsular spread of lymph node metastases
32.explanation: Young age by itself is not an indication for additional adjuvant therapy after resection. It is only when disease is inadequately treated or there is high risk of resection that chemoradiation is indicated.

52.b: Has the inguinal ligament as its medial border

54.question: Which of the following statements regarding endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography

54.c: Is useful in the diagnosis of carcinoma of pancreas
54.d: Is extremely helpful in the management of Klatskin tumour

61.a: et of redness and swelling of the right eye.

67.b: The size of the open wound

68.question: Which of the following is least indicative of radial nerve palsy?
68.explanation: Little finger abduction: APB is median nerve, but APL is by radial nerve

69.d: It most commonly involves the epiphysis of long bone
69.explanation: Codman triangle is not specific, while sunburst is but it is a late sign

70.question: A 40 years old gentleman has sustained an isolated left femoral diaphyseal fracture in traffic
70.a: ident. There is no other injuries. Which of the following is the best treatment for the fracture?
70.explanation: This is a shaft fracture, 95% treated with IM nail, conservative treatment not recommended unless cannot tolerate operation

72.question: Which of the following symptom is most typical of central cord syndrome?
72.explanation: Because somatotropic arrangement of lateral corticospinal tract is upper limb is central (medial) and lower limbs lateral

73.question: A 10-year-old boy who is overweight, complained of sudden onset right hip pain and inability
73.a: bear weight. Examination showed decreased right hip range of motion and obligatory external
73.b: ation on passive flexion of the hip. What is the MOST APPROPRIATE investigation?

73.explanation: Remember to get frog-legged view for comparison

74.explanation: Hindfoot at valgus when tiptoeing displays the too many toes sign classical of PTTD (posterior tibialis tendon dysfunction)

75.b: Always results in malnutrition if unrepaired
75.c: Is often associated with upper airway obstruction
75.d: Should be repaired at one month of age

76.question: What is the optimum age for operation on a child with inguinal hernia?
76.d: As early as possible once diagnosis is made
76.explanation: No need to wait as there is always risk of strangulation

77.question: The optimal time for visualizing the renal parenchyma during urography is at:
77.d: Immediately following completion of contrast injection
77.explanation: Kidneys: appear 1 minute after contrast injection

78.question: The FIRST sign of TUR syndrome is:
78.explanation: Prickling/burning sensation in face or neck is a specific sign in conscious, alert patients

79.explanation: Hirudin is a protease extracted from bloodsucking leeches that function as a thrombin inhibitor

81.b: the haemodynamic status was stable. What should be the MOST appropriate treatment?
81.explanation: IVC filter because patient is hemodynamically stable

82.question: A 55 years old diabetic lady developed an ulcer on plantar surface of the first metatarsal head of
82.a: left foot. The ulcer bed is covered with pink granulation tissue. What is the MOST LIKELY
82.explanation: Neuropathic ulcer, not infected or ischemic, healing is progressing normal, it is just disrupted by loss of pain sensation so the patient did not protect it from further abuse

83.a: ses were palpable. There were no tissue loss or gangrene. The ABI is 1.02. Which of the
83.b: lowing is most appropriate to do?
83.explanation: Duplex ultrasound of leg to rule out other differential first.

84.a: ernal carotid artery. Carotid endarterectomy was performed. She presented with hoarseness
84.b: voice and choking on drinking water. Which of the following is most likely cause of her
84.explanation: Recurrent laryngeal nerve is outside the surgical field, while the vagus nerve is actually inside the carotid sheath
